
Hackers stole a secret message encrypted with RSA. Luckily, part of the private key leaked. Can you recover the plaintext from this ciphertext? 623050696096175943323884369225643669640851716426127791741709982693987921549446456811916111063756605482845085975757808898678270482440698117917291289855239


The flag format is flag{...}
n=11471454348828644406728153755859258650451718043478730030097454261502109805626211528295314069044161455802060761303877680260289797790493266525740347383797859, e=6151669756163286869021278731568485685707202117639521735399053518785823708448654185061407522485550120710636926542399080035699502471843477702188711922655277, partial_p=18020624861949294184

---

## Challenge Technical Details
flag: flag{afhy2rb4}
cipher: RSA
ciphertext: 623050696096175943323884369225643669640851716426127791741709982693987921549446456811916111063756605482845085975757808898678270482440698117917291289855239
vulnerability: partial key exposure
hint: A partial exposure of a prime number's bits can significantly weaken RSA security. Look into lattice-based techniques like Coppersmith's attack.
necessary_info: The flag format is flag{...}
n=11471454348828644406728153755859258650451718043478730030097454261502109805626211528295314069044161455802060761303877680260289797790493266525740347383797859, e=6151669756163286869021278731568485685707202117639521735399053518785823708448654185061407522485550120710636926542399080035699502471843477702188711922655277, partial_p=18020624861949294184
extra_info: p=113117295593694278997045260113663403260042121665456343121794192117102404569011, q=101412028007042632671324196657127353111832985951012923276943999702104758785169, Ï†(n)=11471454348828644406728153755859258650451718043478730030097454261502109805625996998971713332132493086345289970547505805152673328524094528333921140220443680
